definition: (idiom) to rudely push and pull others/(idiom) to evade responsibility and push it to others
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: Don't let people push you around.
sentences.chinese: 不要让人们把你推来推去。

sentences.english: It was a little too harsh to push the boy around.
sentences.chinese: 把那男孩推来推去真的有点过分。

sentences.english: Friends come by , they shake me.
sentences.chinese: 朋友们冲进来，把我推来推去。

sentences.english: I think we dont have to push everybody.
sentences.chinese: 我认为大家没必要推来推去。

sentences.english: Children grow up feeling unsettled as they are moved back and forth between parents.
sentences.chinese: 孩子在这种被父母推来推去的环境中感到动荡不安。

sentences.english: It seems life has been pushing you around and you have quite limited control of it.
sentences.chinese: 似乎生活一直在把你推来推去，而你却很少能掌控它。

sentences.english: He loved to play with my sockets and rolled them around on the shop floor.
sentences.chinese: 他很喜欢玩那些插座零件，在工场里把它们推来推去。
